glsa.title: Ethereal: security problems in ethereal 0.9.15
glsa.synopsis: Ethereal is vulnerable to heap and buffer overflows in the GTP, ISAKMP, MEGACO, and SOCKS protocol dissectors.

background.p: Ethereal is a popular network protocol analyzer.

description.p: Ethereal contains buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the GTP, ISAKMP, and MEGACO protocol dissectors, and a heap overflow vulnerability in the SOCKS protocol dissector, which could cause Ethereal to crash or to execute arbitrary code.

impact.p: A remote attacker could craft a malformed packet which would cause Ethereal to crash or run arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Ethereal.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time, other than to disable the GTP, ISAKMP, MEGACO, and SOCKS protocol dissectors.

resolution.p: It is recommended that all Gentoo Linux users who are running net-analyzer/ethereal 0.9.x upgrade:
resolution.code: # emerge sync # emerge -pv '>=net-analyzer/ethereal-0.9.16' # emerge '>=net-analyzer/ethereal-0.9.16' # emerge clean
